page.title: 10JOHN LEWIS GAMEKEEPER(cont)
page.content:
{ JOHN LEWIS (Part 4)
Pheasants which have wandered away from the estate.The food is still put out in the woods for the pheasants and they eat about a ton a day.Although the "season" begins on October 1st, many shoots do not take place until the end of the month.Throughout November to February John Lewis has most of his time taken up by shoots. They need a lot of planning-by nine am. all the pheasants must be fed,the beaters and retrievers must be ready and transport must be organised for guests.When all this is done the shoot starts.If Mr. Greenwood is away John Lewis takes over as host.Apart from breeding 15,000 pheasants, 2,000 duck and some partridge the keepers also help to look after the estate.To help John Lewis there are four underkeepers
